meanings.definition: A soft or subdued background or underlying song or melody.
meanings.sent1: The undersong of the birds filled the forest with a peaceful hum.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the undersong of the guitar beneath the singer's voice.
meanings.sent3: The undersong of the wind seemed to whisper secrets to the trees.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the undersong of a hidden stream, bubbling beneath the surface.
meanings.sent5: The undersong of the ocean waves lulled me to sleep.

meanings.definition: A hidden or underlying theme or message in a piece of literature or music.
meanings.sent1: The undersong of the novel hinted at deeper emotions the characters kept hidden.
meanings.sent2: The undersong of the song revealed a story of lost love and longing.
meanings.sent3: The undersong of the play added a touch of mystery to the plot.
meanings.sent4: His paintings always contained an undersong of melancholy, hidden beneath vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The undersong of the poem resonated with readers long after they had finished reading.
